intro: Cyrtospermum gummiferum, commonly known as the gumtree sphaerocarp, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, globular fruit capsules. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are opposite and usually have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Cyrtospermum gummiferum is known for its ability to produce a sticky resin, which gives it its common name.
